snippet: Vladimir Medinsky has called for burying Lenin’s corpse and renaming streets after the murdered family of Czar Nicholas II.
abstract: Vladimir Medinsky, Russia’s new culture minister, calls for burying Lenin’s preserved corpse and renaming streets after the murdered czar’s family, reopening long, simmering debate; as tensions mount between the opposition and the government, critics say Medinsky's statements are designed to deflect criticism of his appointment, and distract antigovernment protesters.
lead_paragraph: Vladimir Medinsky has called for burying Lenin’s corpse and renaming streets after the murdered family of Czar Nicholas II.

headline.seo: Russia’s Culture Minister Stirs Debate Over Soviet Past
headline.main: Bury Lenin? Russian Minister Stirs Debate Over Soviet Past
headline.print_headline: Bury Lenin? Russian Minister Stirs Debate Over Soviet Past
